data:
1
00:01:12,126 --> 00:01:18,162
I am Knull, god of the
void, slicer of worlds.

2
00:01:18,382 --> 00:01:20,411
A long ago,

3
00:01:20,487 --> 00:01:22,979
when the light invaded my kingdom,

4
00:01:23,203 --> 00:01:30,019
my symbiote children betrayed
me and imprisoned me here.

5
00:01:34,064 --> 00:01:40,406
At last, a Codex is being created.
It's the key to my freedom.

6
00:01:40,945 --> 00:01:43,558
It will unlock this prison.

7
00:01:43,990 --> 00:01:48,670
I order you to search
the corners of the universe

8
00:01:48,705 --> 00:01:51,754
until you find this key.

9
00:01:51,755 --> 00:01:54,876
Find me the Codex.

10
00:02:02,023 --> 00:02:04,982
And when I escape and annihilate

11
00:02:04,997 --> 00:02:09,734
every living planet and
destroy my symbiote offspring,

12
00:02:10,780 --> 00:02:15,443
I will reward you with your lives.

13
00:02:38,547 --> 00:02:44,071
Subtitles by Bambula

14
00:02:50,849 --> 00:02:54,633
So you're saying in this universe
there's these superhero people.

15
00:02:54,734 --> 00:02:56,798
All right.

16
00:02:56,813 --> 00:03:00,485
So tell me again about
your purple alien friend

17
00:03:00,520 --> 00:03:04,644
who really loves stones.
I'll tell you what, man,

18
00:03:05,149 --> 00:03:08,408
aliens, they do not love stones.

19
00:03:08,533 --> 00:03:12,208
Eddie, don't start.
-No, no... Do not love stones.

20
00:03:13,137 --> 00:03:15,137
Do you know what they love?

21
00:03:15,374 --> 00:03:19,211
They love eating brains,
because that's what they do.

22
00:03:19,670 --> 00:03:25,285
Senor, he made my family
disappear for five years.

23
00:03:26,642 --> 00:03:32,291
Five years. -Si.
-That is a long time.

24
00:03:34,059 --> 00:03:38,695
All right.
-Eddie, we are drunk.

25
00:03:52,027 --> 00:03:55,798
We are at home. I'm so done
with the multiverse shit.

26
00:03:55,923 --> 00:03:58,277
I like our version of
the bartender better.

27
00:03:58,505 --> 00:04:04,548
My head hurts. I feel like I'm drunk,
but I'm also hungover at the same time.

28
00:04:04,673 --> 00:04:07,508
Eddie, you want a Bloody Maria.

29
00:04:07,509 --> 00:04:09,509
Oorah!

30
00:04:12,973 --> 00:04:14,973
I don't want to drink.

31
00:04:16,160 --> 00:04:17,685
Oh, my God.

32
00:04:17,686 --> 00:04:20,287
Stop! You're destroying this man's bar.

33
00:04:27,226 --> 00:04:30,388
Tequilla!
I'm having a time of my life today.

34
00:04:31,994 --> 00:04:35,505
I'd rather a glass of water.
-Be a man, Eddie.

35
00:04:36,541 --> 00:04:39,201
We should have been bartender.

36
00:04:43,337 --> 00:04:45,376
Tequila!
-I did it.

37
00:04:45,377 --> 00:04:47,377
I did it.
-Sir?

38
00:04:48,467 --> 00:04:51,510
What the hell were these things?

39
00:04:52,262 --> 00:04:54,262
I was born with them.

40
00:04:55,098 --> 00:04:57,460
Freaking bar, I'm done with this shit.

41
00:05:00,812 --> 00:05:03,519
This is Kelly Roulet,
reporting from San Francisco.

42
00:05:03,644 --> 00:05:05,987
Police are still trying to locate

43
00:05:06,112 --> 00:05:08,823
former reporter Eddie Brock
for questioning... -Oh, no.

44
00:05:08,948 --> 00:05:13,412
...after the tragic death of
Detective Patrick Mulligan. -No.

45
00:05:13,537 --> 00:05:18,151
Detective Mulligan was found impaled
and that's a series of bizarre happenings

46
00:05:18,276 --> 00:05:21,166
at the city's cathedral.
-They think I killed him.

47
00:05:21,291 --> 00:05:24,870
How long can he evade
authorities? Only time will tell.

48
00:05:24,995 --> 00:05:30,327
If we're on the news here,
we're on the news everywhere.

49
00:05:32,010 --> 00:05:35,259
We can't go back to San Francisco
and I'm not staying down here

50
00:05:35,294 --> 00:05:38,272
hiding for the rest of my
life in Mexico, that' for sure.

51
00:05:38,307 --> 00:05:41,111
Where will we go?
-I don't know. I don't know.

52
00:05:47,508 --> 00:05:51,906
That could work. This judge
got me kicked out of New York.

53
00:05:52,031 --> 00:05:55,096
What a dick.
-Yeah, I still have a ton of shit on him too.

54
00:05:55,450 --> 00:05:58,675
I always wanted to see
the Statue of Liberty.

55
00:05:58,935 --> 00:06:00,935
Maybe we can blackmail him.

56
00:06:02,015 --> 00:06:04,475
To clear my name.

57
00:06:04,476 --> 00:06:07,247
Let's go! Road trip!

58
00:06:07,250 --> 00:06:09,250
Let's get the hell out of here.

59
00:06:09,631 --> 00:06:11,631
Keep the change.

60
00:06:17,076 --> 00:06:19,880
We keep our heads down
and we keep moving.

61
00:06:22,936 --> 00:06:29,192
We are fugitives. We are on the
run. Yes, we are in the shit.

62
00:06:29,317 --> 00:06:34,231
Yes, but I will eat every bad guy
that gets in our way.

63
00:06:34,524 --> 00:06:36,524
I need a Tylenol.

64
00:06:49,296 --> 00:06:51,296
Did you hear that?

65
00:07:02,184 --> 00:07:07,929
Someone's in trouble and I need
fuel for the road. -Yeah, okay.

66
00:07:28,358 --> 00:07:30,358
That way.

67
00:07:40,616 --> 00:07:42,616
Bad men, Eddie.

68
00:07:43,402 --> 00:07:47,032
Are we the Lethal Protector or not?

69
00:07:51,024 --> 00:07:53,937
Do your thing.
-Easy peasy.

70
00:08:10,585 --> 00:08:12,585
Jesus.

71
00:08:19,058 --> 00:08:22,137
Cute. I promise not to eat it.

72
00:08:24,352 --> 00:08:28,923
They are fighting dogs.
-I draw the line at fighting dogs, pal.

73
00:08:33,012 --> 00:08:38,351
What are you doing here, asshole?
You're in the wrong place.

74
00:08:40,133 --> 00:08:43,135
Hello.
-This is our territory.

75
00:08:43,929 --> 00:08:47,864
Well, I assume by the
threatening look on your faces

76
00:08:48,569 --> 00:08:50,569
that I ought to be scared, right?

77
00:08:52,569 --> 00:08:54,834
You took the wrong
path, my brother.

78
00:08:55,869 --> 00:09:00,260
We can't let you leave.
-I have a headache.

79
00:09:00,557 --> 00:09:05,275
On account of the fact that I was
drinking a lot. I'm going to be honest.

80
00:09:05,345 --> 00:09:11,474
I have a really dark and unpredictable
side to me. -We all have monsters inside us.

81
00:09:11,935 --> 00:09:17,228
Not like this. So dark that it is
highly likely to tear your head off

82
00:09:17,471 --> 00:09:22,339
and feed it to your asshole.
-Or me. You can feed it to me.

83
00:09:22,464 --> 00:09:24,464
I can feed it to him.

84
00:09:25,245 --> 00:09:28,615
All right, look. Whoa, whoa, whoa. Come
on. I got a suggestion. -No, stop speaking.

85
00:09:28,740 --> 00:09:30,740
I'm not going to stop
speaking. This is for you.

86
00:09:30,848 --> 00:09:33,036
I'm doing this for
your benefit, all right?

87
00:09:33,161 --> 00:09:35,212
I don't have to. Okay?
Just pay attention.

88
00:09:35,337 --> 00:09:37,789
We're going to find
all of these dogs loving homes,

89
00:09:37,914 --> 00:09:40,124
because what you're
doing is reprehensible.

90
00:09:40,249 --> 00:09:42,866
And what does your
mother think of you, man?

91
00:09:43,254 --> 00:09:48,222
My mother is dead, you idiot.
-You made it awkward. -I'm sorry to hear that.

92
00:09:48,347 --> 00:09:50,358
Shut up!

93
00:09:50,658 --> 00:09:52,658
I'll fuck you up.

94
00:09:55,851 --> 00:09:59,060
Do you understand?
-I'm giving you a chance.

95
00:09:59,269 --> 00:10:03,645
Sweety, I'm really giving you a
chance. You should probably take it.

96
00:10:04,555 --> 00:10:06,731
Yes?
-Yes.

97
00:10:08,177 --> 00:10:10,270
Okay.

98
00:10:10,325 --> 00:10:12,325
Say when.
-When.

99
00:10:21,766 --> 00:10:24,047
Hello, bitches.

100
00:10:49,593 --> 00:10:51,593
Who is the bad boy?

101
00:10:58,265 --> 00:11:00,273
That's sturdy footwear.

102
00:11:03,152 --> 00:11:09,059
Where are you going?
-Home. -No.

103
00:11:16,528 --> 00:11:18,528
What...

104
00:11:19,312 --> 00:11:21,390
are you?

105
00:11:21,861 --> 00:11:24,201
We are...
-We are Venom!

106
00:11:25,161 --> 00:11:28,834
We are...
-Venom! -No.

107
00:11:29,423 --> 00:11:33,974
Yeah, we are Venom.

108
00:11:34,953 --> 00:11:39,359
What? -We're totally going
to need to work on that.

109
00:11:48,526 --> 00:11:54,114
That was delicious.
-You're welcome. Thank you.

110
00:11:54,239 --> 00:11:58,732
You take me to all the finest places.
-Let's get the hell out of here.

111
00:11:58,857 --> 00:12:04,731
Where is my shoe? Hey, buddy.
It's my shoe. It's my shoe.

112
00:12:04,856 --> 00:12:06,856
Give me my shoe.

113
00:12:13,253 --> 00:12:15,296
These will fit.

114
00:12:15,345 --> 00:12:18,745
Now we are on the run for
something we actually did do.

115
00:12:18,942 --> 00:12:23,565
And I got stuck with
the superhero who can't fly. -Wanna bet?

116
00:12:46,703 --> 00:12:48,132
POSITIVE ID
MEXICO

117
00:12:48,133 --> 00:12:50,133
There you are.

118
00:12:52,864 --> 00:12:54,864
Get me General Strickland.

119
00:13:14,645 --> 00:13:16,645
What the...

120
00:13:23,944 --> 00:13:25,944
Viral shedding.

121
00:13:26,706 --> 00:13:28,706
These things want to live.

122
00:13:33,541 --> 00:13:39,396
Hello. -Hello. -Tell me about
the man who was just here.

123
00:13:44,764 --> 00:13:47,561
He was acting like
crazy talking to himself.

124
00:13:48,559 --> 00:13:55,160
What did he say?
-He had these big, massive, wild arms.

125
00:13:56,052 --> 00:13:58,052
They were wobbling like this.

126
00:14:00,247 --> 00:14:02,247
Bring him.

127
00:14:08,536 --> 00:14:10,536
NEVADA DESERT

128
00:14:20,362 --> 00:14:23,154
Do you think there are other
brothers and sisters in those stars?

129
00:14:24,562 --> 00:14:29,147
Looking at the same sky?
-I'll be able to tell you one day.

130
00:14:32,455 --> 00:14:36,227
My twin brother.
A future NASA scientist.

131
00:14:37,251 --> 00:14:39,251
One day.

132
00:14:42,243 --> 00:14:44,766
When thunder roars,
head indoors.

133
00:15:02,165 --> 00:15:04,165
No!

134
00:15:13,274 --> 00:15:15,284
STRICKLAND:
MULLIGAN EN ROUTE

135
00:15:35,308 --> 00:15:39,010
He is on life support.
Get him to emergency symbiosis now.

136
00:15:52,475 --> 00:15:54,475
It should be you.

137
00:15:56,148 --> 00:15:58,629
They just came across a
news desk and it bears repeating.

138
00:15:58,754 --> 00:16:02,225
For all you alien
enthusiasts out there, it's a sad day.

139
00:16:02,350 --> 00:16:06,249
Washington has finally
announced the decommissioning of Area 51.

140
00:16:06,374 --> 00:16:10,160
The controversial site is
famous for its alleged testing on aliens.

141
00:16:10,542 --> 00:16:12,542
In other news today...

142
00:16:15,148 --> 00:16:19,148
AREA 51 MILITARY BASE, NEVADA
3 DAYS TO DECOMMISSION

143
00:16:25,226 --> 00:16:29,059
Right this way. Come on up.

144
00:16:39,692 --> 00:16:41,712
HYPERACID DISSOLVENT

145
00:16:43,148 --> 00:16:45,434
Strickland.
-Strickland authorized.

146
00:16:45,559 --> 00:16:49,080
INIIATING ACID SHOWER
WARNING BIOHAZARD

147
00:17:01,350 --> 00:17:03,350
It's finally happening then?

148
00:17:04,647 --> 00:17:09,130
Yes, ma'am. There'll be nothing
left but rock and dust. -And roaches.

149
00:17:09,255 --> 00:17:11,255
Even the biggest of
bangs couldn't kill them.

150
00:17:11,543 --> 00:17:14,185
They've been around
280 million years and counting.

151
00:17:14,734 --> 00:17:16,734
I didn't know that, Dr. Paine.

152
00:17:23,459 --> 00:17:26,547
Good to go. -Have a good one, Gus.
-You too.

153
00:17:50,948 --> 00:17:55,852
AREA 55, PROGRAM IMPERIUM
SYMBIOTE CONTAINMENT AND ANALYSIS

154
00:17:59,863 --> 00:18:01,865
Thank you.
-Yes, ma'am.

155
00:18:07,657 --> 00:18:10,348
Good morning, Dr. Paine.
We'll keep it safe for you.

156
00:18:10,473 --> 00:18:14,451
I still don't think anyone wants my old
beater, Jim. -Never judge a book by its cover.

157
00:18:18,540 --> 00:18:21,063
Early morning wake up, General Strickland.

158
00:18:21,462 --> 00:18:25,949
Looks like all your dreams came true.
-I know how that must bug you.

159
00:18:26,955 --> 00:18:31,030
He arrived shortly before you did.
-Did our new friend give them any trouble?

160
00:18:31,155 --> 00:18:33,155
You see, that's exactly the problem.

161
00:18:33,254 --> 00:18:35,869
What?
-Your assumption we're meeting friends.

162
00:18:37,431 --> 00:18:39,431
Good morning.
-Good morning.

163
00:18:40,352 --> 00:18:43,955
The bonding was successful.
-I heard.

164
00:18:47,661 --> 00:18:50,726
You always have this look on your
face like something terrible is imminent.

165
00:18:50,851 --> 00:18:55,701
Because in my line of work something
terrible is always imminent. We contain them.

166
00:18:55,826 --> 00:18:59,441
You study them.
That's how it works.

167
00:19:05,652 --> 00:19:08,297
Let's have a look.
-Hello, doctor. -Hello.

168
00:19:08,569 --> 00:19:10,651
His other Symbiote left him for dead.

169
00:19:10,652 --> 00:19:12,652
SUBJECT: PATRICK MULLIGAN
HEART RATE

170
00:19:12,859 --> 00:19:15,836
We saved him. He would have died.

171
00:19:15,961 --> 00:19:17,961
COMPLETE SYMBIOSIS

172
00:19:19,548 --> 00:19:21,548
Try lowering the levels.

173
00:19:27,155 --> 00:19:31,929
Good morning, Sadie. -Let me get
that. -We got this down in Mexico.

174
00:19:32,054 --> 00:19:36,920
Hi. Welcome. -Any more on
where the rest of it is?

175
00:19:37,045 --> 00:19:39,352
We're getting there.
-Update me as you have it.

176
00:19:41,660 --> 00:19:43,565
I don't get this obsession.

177
00:19:43,566 --> 00:19:47,944
I told you, my mom made
this pin. -It's July.

178
00:19:48,069 --> 00:19:50,069
I'll see you in there.

179
00:19:51,148 --> 00:19:56,821
Everyone on this site is
weird. -Leave her alone, Rex.

180
00:19:56,946 --> 00:19:59,656
God forbid anyone should
actually enjoy their work.

181
00:20:14,348 --> 00:20:17,038
Area 51 will be fully decommissioned
by the end of the week.

182
00:20:17,163 --> 00:20:20,920
It's just a shipwreck anyway
and they're tired of the tourists.

183
00:20:21,045 --> 00:20:25,021
We don't exist down here.
-100 feet subsurface,

184
00:20:25,146 --> 00:20:29,432
undetectable to any human or non-human.

185
00:20:29,557 --> 00:20:34,937
No one's phoning home from here. -My brother's
greatest ambition was to work up there at 51

186
00:20:35,062 --> 00:20:39,866
doing what I do. And I wish I could
have shown him what we built down here.

187
00:20:44,433 --> 00:20:49,726
You're okay. Just...
Try to breath.

188
00:20:49,851 --> 00:20:51,851
Okay?

189
00:20:52,070 --> 00:20:54,290
When my brother and I were kids
they told us

190
00:20:54,359 --> 00:20:57,013
that UFOs were just weather balloons.
Space thrash.

191
00:20:57,138 --> 00:21:00,457
Kubrick directed the Moon
landing in a Hollywood studio.

192
00:21:01,044 --> 00:21:04,717
Cool story.
-Where are you going? This first.

193
00:21:04,842 --> 00:21:09,266
Is there an increased risk of exposure?
-It's not us I'm worried about.

194
00:21:09,652 --> 00:21:11,769
You know we carry
all kinds of viruses and bacteria

195
00:21:11,804 --> 00:21:14,054
that could be
harmful to a sensitive lifeform.

196
00:21:14,255 --> 00:21:16,255
And we don't know exactly
what we're dealing with here.

197
00:21:17,049 --> 00:21:19,049
As long as we're keeping the guests safe.

198
00:21:25,671 --> 00:21:28,708
This is the first time we've had a
host compatible with one of our symbiotes.

199
00:21:28,833 --> 00:21:30,833
And now we'll be able to talk to one.

200
00:21:49,732 --> 00:21:52,688
He's been experiencing panic
surges since we've bonded him.

201
00:21:52,813 --> 00:21:57,323
Try Jingle Bells. So soothing.
-Why didn't I think of that?

202
00:21:59,850 --> 00:22:01,850
Release him.

203
00:22:05,542 --> 00:22:07,542
Monsters.

204
00:22:09,730 --> 00:22:11,943
I'm Dr. Paine. Teddy.

205
00:22:12,965 --> 00:22:19,303
You are safe here.
We're gonna help you. Both of you.

206
00:22:20,494 --> 00:22:22,538
The transfer was successful.

207
00:22:23,854 --> 00:22:27,244
We had no choice.
We had to try and save you.

208
00:22:34,153 --> 00:22:36,153
The monsters.

209
00:22:43,576 --> 00:22:45,576
You're broken too.

210
00:22:54,129 --> 00:22:56,129
May I...

211
00:22:59,226 --> 00:23:01,226
May I ask you some questions?

212
00:23:05,999 --> 00:23:08,042
Is the symbiote communicating with you?

213
00:23:11,153 --> 00:23:13,153
Do you hear it?

214
00:23:15,557 --> 00:23:17,557
The sound distresses them.

215
00:23:19,865 --> 00:23:21,865
Okay.

216
00:23:24,288 --> 00:23:29,542
Why are they here? -What do they
want? -Safe haven. -Safe haven?

217
00:23:29,667 --> 00:23:33,546
We were running.
-Is he talking about the other symbiotes?

218
00:23:33,671 --> 00:23:38,846
I think so. -His creatures
search the universe for us.

219
00:23:39,937 --> 00:23:41,937
We will be found.

220
00:23:43,955 --> 00:23:47,591
And when we are, he will kill us all.

221
00:23:49,581 --> 00:23:53,117
Who?
-There will be nothing left.

222
00:23:54,088 --> 00:23:56,088
Here? On Earth?

223
00:23:59,040 --> 00:24:03,875
Why were they running?
-Because there is a dark,

224
00:24:04,675 --> 00:24:10,059
cold sea around this universe.

225
00:24:10,958 --> 00:24:12,958
What is it?

226
00:24:19,348 --> 00:24:22,002
You don't want to know.

227
00:24:30,894 --> 00:24:33,782
I've seen the future.

228
00:24:51,072 --> 00:24:54,290
The darkness...

229
00:24:54,943 --> 00:24:59,506
has teeth.

230
00:25:04,349 --> 00:25:05,830
This is your captain speaking.

231
00:25:05,831 --> 00:25:09,542
We are currently
cruising at a comfortable 31,000 feet.

232
00:25:09,768 --> 00:25:14,555
If you look out there to your left,
just now you will see the Grand Canyon.

233
00:25:16,982 --> 00:25:19,582
I told you we could fly!
-My God!

234
00:25:19,707 --> 00:25:23,030
Direct to New York!
-My mouth is so dry!

235
00:25:23,155 --> 00:25:27,034
And we will clear your name!
-It's so unpleasantly cold!

236
00:25:28,521 --> 00:25:32,523
How does Tom Cruise do this?
-He doesn't whine like a little bitch!

237
00:25:44,728 --> 00:25:46,728
What was that?

238
00:25:48,782 --> 00:25:52,287
What is that?
-Oh, fuck!

239
00:26:15,112 --> 00:26:17,549
I'm sorry, Eddie,
but I gotta disappear.

240
00:26:17,674 --> 00:26:20,374
What, now?
-We're in deep shit!

241
00:26:21,880 --> 00:26:23,880
Why did you do that?

242
00:26:24,883 --> 00:26:26,883
I will explain.

243
00:26:27,257 --> 00:26:29,257
No!

244
00:26:33,177 --> 00:26:35,177
No!

245
00:26:40,530 --> 00:26:44,575
I'm gonna go ahead and say that
this is the shittest hangover of all time.

246
00:26:45,229 --> 00:26:50,617
Look at it, Eddie.
Isn't it just astonishing? -Shut up.

247
00:26:50,742 --> 00:26:53,746
I don't think I mind
living here forever.

248

We just came face to face
with a literal death machine.

249

"Forever" seems pretty optimistic.

250
00:27:05,825 --> 00:27:08,113
With the decommissioning of Area 51,

251
00:27:08,226 --> 00:27:11,486

that they've been holding UAP?

252
00:27:11,611 --> 00:27:16,236
That's an unidentified aerial
phenomenon to you. -Yeah, Dad, we know.

253
00:27:16,361 --> 00:27:18,930
What I wouldn't give to get to see
who built one of those things.

254
00:27:19,055 --> 00:27:22,621
That's why we cashed in our
savings and came on this road trip, babe.

255
00:27:22,858 --> 00:27:27,026
So you could finally get to see.
-That's bullshit. -Yeah, what if I'm right?

256
00:27:27,151 --> 00:27:31,601
Then I really hope we don't end up in
an alien space lab with probes up our asses.

257
00:27:32,284 --> 00:27:35,286
Or dead.
-Asses.

258
00:27:44,396 --> 00:27:48,217
Kicked up some gravel there.
Hang tight, family. -You good?

259
00:27:48,342 --> 00:27:52,261
That was wild!
-Did the dog vomit? -Yeah.

260
00:28:04,807 --> 00:28:09,823
Okay, we got this. Soft landing.
Bend your knees.

261
00:28:09,948 --> 00:28:12,239
Engage your core. Engage your core!

262
00:28:12,971 --> 00:28:16,118
Yes, yes, that's it.
Yes! That's it!

263
00:28:19,416 --> 00:28:22,858
Well done.
-That was terrifying.

264
00:28:24,109 --> 00:28:27,464
This is not New York.
No, this is a wasteland.

265

I'm detecting passive aggression.
-Are you? -Yeah. -I'm sorry.

266
00:28:31,135 --> 00:28:32,885
How about some active aggression?

267
00:28:32,886 --> 00:28:35,903
You just threw me off a 757

268
00:28:36,028 --> 00:28:40,246
without even the slightest
consideration from my chronic vertigo.

269
00:28:40,371 --> 00:28:45,856
It was an Airbus A320.
-Was it? I'm sorry. All right.

270
00:28:46,061 --> 00:28:49,808
And what was that thing?
That thing that we just juiced back there?

271
00:28:49,933 --> 00:28:54,156
You're not gonna like this. -No, I can
absolutely guarantee that I'm not gonna.

272
00:28:56,530 --> 00:28:59,683
What are you doing? Why are you doing
this? That's a pretty weird. That's creepy.

273
00:28:59,808 --> 00:29:04,479
That was a xenophage.
-A what? -A xenophage.

274
00:29:04,604 --> 00:29:06,604
A symbiote hunter.
-Of course.

275
00:29:06,729 --> 00:29:12,217
Problem is, if she has found her way
here, others will soon follow. -Others?

276
00:29:12,342 --> 00:29:15,613
The xenophage's maker
also created us, symbiotes.

277
00:29:15,738 --> 00:29:19,395
So that's your sister.
-The symbiotes turne on him.

278
00:29:19,520 --> 00:29:23,395
Locked him up on Klyntar.
-Your planet. -No, not a planet.

279
00:29:23,520 --> 00:29:26,109
Not your planet.
-The prison we built for him to sleep.

280
00:29:26,234 --> 00:29:30,715
Of course. -For eternity.
-What's its name then?

281

I didn't hear what you said.
-Knull. -Knull! -No!

282
00:29:39,564 --> 00:29:43,947
This is serious, Eddie.
-This is the talk.

283
00:29:44,714 --> 00:29:46,714
Quiet.

284
00:29:51,044 --> 00:29:55,648
What does that xyno... xen thingy
that symbiote hunter wants with you anyway?

285
00:29:55,773 --> 00:29:59,254
It doesn't. It wants us both.
We have something it needs.

286
00:29:59,354 --> 00:30:04,317
We only have this shitty shirt.
We got one boot. Sunburn.

287
00:30:04,318 --> 00:30:06,855
And the Codex.
-What now?

288
00:30:07,114 --> 00:30:09,114
I'll show you.

289
00:30:10,094 --> 00:30:13,866
Damn it! What are you doing?
-Let's say you died.

290
00:30:13,991 --> 00:30:17,691

-I'd like that. -But if I did,

291
00:30:17,735 --> 00:30:24,373

one single force called the Codex.

292
00:30:24,498 --> 00:30:30,045
What the hell is a Codex?
-It's a key. A key that unlocks a cage.

293
00:30:30,666 --> 00:30:34,251
The prison on Klyntar.
-It would free our creator.

294
00:30:34,376 --> 00:30:38,177
Well, thank God we haven't died.
-Yeah, except that one time.

295
00:30:40,643 --> 00:30:44,871
Oh, no. No. So you're telling me
we're carrying this thing?

296
00:30:44,996 --> 00:30:48,992
That's why the xenophage is
hunting us. -What do we do?

297
00:30:49,117 --> 00:30:53,495
She can only see the Codex when a
Symbiote is in its full true form.

298
00:30:56,479 --> 00:31:01,814
Right. You mean you can't come out.
-I can do this. I can do this.

299
00:31:01,939 --> 00:31:04,304
But if I fully transform,

300
00:31:04,429 --> 00:31:06,792
the Codex sends her a tracking signal.

301
00:31:06,917 --> 00:31:09,976
She will find us, rip
it out of our spine

302
00:31:10,011 --> 00:31:11,752
and free Knull from Klyntar.

303
00:31:11,753 --> 00:31:13,416
How do we get rid of this Codex?

304
00:31:13,417 --> 00:31:17,828
As long as you and I both live,
the Codex exists.

305
00:31:18,218 --> 00:31:21,171
If one of us should die...
-No. -...the Codex will die.

306
00:31:21,296 --> 00:31:23,465
That's not gonna work for me.
-Or me!

307
00:31:24,096 --> 00:31:26,077
That xenophage was fast.

308
00:31:26,078 --> 00:31:28,078
It won't take long for the feds to tie us

309
00:31:28,103 --> 00:31:30,853

bodies we left in Mexico.

310
00:31:30,978 --> 00:31:33,108
We gotta get outta here.
-Yeah, we better go.

311
00:31:38,572 --> 00:31:42,782
Four legs are better than one.
-Be honest with me, buddy.

312
00:31:43,577 --> 00:31:47,959
How fast do you think you can get
that thing to go without killing it?

313
00:31:48,084 --> 00:31:51,946
Only one way to find out.
Don't scare him.

314
00:31:52,213 --> 00:31:54,213
Don't scare horsey, horsey.

315
00:31:56,412 --> 00:32:00,970
Nice horsey. Nice horsey.

316
00:32:02,396 --> 00:32:04,396
Surprise, horsey!

317
00:32:05,471 --> 00:32:07,471
I love horsey!

318
00:32:26,036 --> 00:32:31,666
Ride me, cowboy! -You're an asshole!
I swear to God, when I get off this horse,

319
00:32:31,791 --> 00:32:34,119
I'm gonna kick your ass, you mother...

320

That's horse power!

321

Safe haven? No. They are not
here for a safe haven.

322

evict the current tenants?

323

324
00:33:12,623 --> 00:33:14,623
Have I?

325

They were running. That's what he said.
-Don't kid yourself.

326
00:33:24,297 --> 00:33:28,779
They were always migrating.
A meteor carrying symbiote life,

327
00:33:28,904 --> 00:33:33,800

survive. Coincidence? Give me a break.

328
00:33:35,624 --> 00:33:40,271
All right. Let's go get them.

329

You're so desperate to believe
that they're here for altruistic reasons.

330
00:33:45,949 --> 00:33:47,949
Makes you dangerous.

331

We just intercepted an
emergency call from an Airbus out of Mexico,

332

333
00:34:04,312 --> 00:34:08,308
We'll take the Osprey.
Eyes wide, Paine.

334
00:34:17,355 --> 00:34:19,452
I can't feel my balls.

335
00:34:21,114 --> 00:34:24,167
Damn... That was horrible.

336

Visual on target.

337
00:34:44,649 --> 00:34:48,747

HUMAN DETECTED
SYMBIOTE DETECTED

No, the Codex!

342

else out here. -Something else?

345

Samples?

348

Those were not Feds.
Those were some special forces shit.

349

They were trying to kill us.

350
00:38:43,933 --> 00:38:47,854
Great. So now we have the cops,
the United States Army

351

352

God, I just saw blood that sprayed

353

00:40:40,003 --> 00:40:42,003
I sense...

368

369
00:41:17,191 --> 00:41:21,386

370
00:41:28,563 --> 00:41:33,368

371

Venom carries the key to Knull's

372
00:41:39,828 --> 00:41:41,828
Or your race will be killed.

373
00:41:42,910 --> 00:41:46,973
You, and you...

374
00:41:47,815 --> 00:41:49,721
And...

375
00:41:49,722 --> 00:41:51,722
you.

376

Yeah.

It's pretty wild out there.

00:44:16,448 --> 00:44:22,729
I know. -Yeah.

wife, Nova Moon. -Hi.

00:44:42,505 --> 00:44:48,253
Who is a dog. -And I'm Martin.

00:44:52,104 --> 00:44:54,447

namaste, man. -Thank you.

408
00:45:11,516 --> 00:45:14,738
New York. -Oh, wow.

00:45:18,346 --> 00:45:22,270
Yeah. We could
ride you up to Vegas. -Yeah.

These people are weird. I'm telling you.

412

413

419

So we're riding the
extraterrestrial highway. -Yep.

420
00:45:51,518 --> 00:45:54,853

-It's the road that leads to Area 51.

421
00:45:54,978 --> 00:45:59,039

422

Not a believer?

Actually, Martin, how
do I put this?

425
00:46:12,777 --> 00:46:18,815
I am. That's the I am I big, big believer.

Are you a comedian now?
-And, actually, I was in IT.

427
00:46:21,913 --> 00:46:25,470

-That's so cool. -Thanks.

428

I hope you don't get
disappointed, you know?

429
00:46:29,403 --> 00:46:32,888

430
00:46:32,889 --> 00:46:36,763

431
00:46:40,021 --> 00:46:45,917
Not a bad one.
-Yeah. -Yeah. -Well...

432
00:46:46,922 --> 00:46:50,304
I know a dark
force when I see one, Eddie.

433

It's kind of hot in here.
-You get used to it.

434

435
00:47:07,261 --> 00:47:12,434

Just think of this as the tour bus.

Come on. Don't be square.

Sometimes I think we would have

455
00:48:47,038 --> 00:48:49,570
And the papers want to
know whose shirts you wear...

I know.

458
00:48:58,928 --> 00:49:05,244
This is Major Tom to Ground Control

00:49:06,463 --> 00:49:11,690
And I'm floating in a most peculiar way

00:49:12,414 --> 00:49:16,595
And the stars look very different today

461
00:49:17,740 --> 00:49:23,438
For here, am I sitting in a tin can

Far above the world

00:49:29,165 --> 00:49:31,165
WELCOME TO FABULOUS LAS VEGAS

They don't? I have a

468
00:50:18,076 --> 00:50:24,928
I don't want to see an alien.
-You don't? -Scary.

469
00:50:27,659 --> 00:50:31,865
Okay. Well, you know,
it's okay to be scared.

470
00:50:33,567 --> 00:50:37,612
I am scared, like, all the time.

471
00:50:38,648 --> 00:50:40,648
Promise I won't see anyone?

472
00:50:44,991 --> 00:50:46,991
Buddy.

473
00:50:47,841 --> 00:50:53,944
Aliens are not real, okay?
I promise.

474
00:50:55,002 --> 00:50:57,002
Okay?

475
00:51:04,096 --> 00:51:08,366
You said the right thing.
You would make a good dad.

476
00:51:22,291 --> 00:51:25,300
We've come a long way, you and me.

477
00:51:26,428 --> 00:51:28,749
We have many more roads to travel, buddy.

478
00:51:28,874 --> 00:51:31,401
Wouldn't that be nice?
-Did you say something?

479
00:51:34,158 --> 00:51:37,899
No, just dreaming, I guess.

480
00:51:46,120 --> 00:51:48,128
That's Nierika.

481
00:51:48,912 --> 00:51:53,325
Nierika? -Yes.
There's a doorway in our minds

482
00:51:53,450 --> 00:51:58,395
that usually remains hidden in secret
until the time of death.

483
00:52:00,496 --> 00:52:02,725
Crazy things in this world, Eddie.

484
00:52:04,674 --> 00:52:06,725
You can see them if you are open.

485
00:52:08,359 --> 00:52:10,359
I've seen them.

486
00:52:13,606 --> 00:52:17,180
I'm glad we didn't eat
this fine family.

487
00:52:45,183 --> 00:52:48,059
Welcome to the city of second chances.

488
00:53:05,913 --> 00:53:10,940
Thank you, thank you. Take care,
buddy. Thank you. -Stay, Blue. Stay.

489
00:53:11,541 --> 00:53:13,541
Vegas.

490
00:53:14,584 --> 00:53:17,502
POSITIVE IDENTIFICATION
NAME: EDWARD BROCK

491
00:53:17,627 --> 00:53:23,096
Listen, I just want you to have this.
Please. -Oh, Martin, that's... Thank you.

492
00:53:23,221 --> 00:53:25,109
And quality support, cushioning.

493
00:53:25,110 --> 00:53:28,170
Plus, they come with
an anti-microbial footbed.

494
00:53:28,295 --> 00:53:32,868
No, reject them.
Worse than Crocs. -Thank you.

495
00:53:32,993 --> 00:53:39,124
Oh, baby, baby, it's a wild world
But I will always remember you

496
00:53:43,282 --> 00:53:49,005
Goodbye, Martin. -It's goodbye for
now. That's what I like to think, Eddie.

497
00:53:50,300 --> 00:53:54,595
Okay, bye.
-Hey, Martin.

498
00:53:55,773 --> 00:54:00,916
That doorway... -Nierika?
-Yes, it's open.

499
00:54:01,425 --> 00:54:05,099
Okay... just... Be safe.

500
00:54:07,144 --> 00:54:10,024
Okay. Thanks.

501
00:54:17,518 --> 00:54:19,518
Jesus.

502
00:54:20,559 --> 00:54:22,561
This is the all-time low.

503
00:54:30,984 --> 00:54:32,984
You got chocolate!

504
00:54:35,231 --> 00:54:37,231
Yum!

505
00:54:44,967 --> 00:54:49,144
I'd like to see her when
we get to New York, Eddie.

506
00:54:49,586 --> 00:54:53,229
You know, she was built to
welcome visitors to America, buddy.

507
00:54:53,639 --> 00:54:59,093
That's you. -You think so, Eddie?
-Oh yeah, I know so.

508
00:54:59,218 --> 00:55:01,172
When we get out of this mess,
we're gonna go see her.

509
00:55:01,173 --> 00:55:05,292
We're gonna say, "Hi, Lady Liberty."
-And see a Broadway show!

510
00:55:05,744 --> 00:55:07,744
Yeah, sure.
-Wow.

511
00:55:08,446 --> 00:55:11,203
I know how much you hate musicals.

512
00:55:12,761 --> 00:55:14,761
Yeah, it's gonna be great.

513
00:55:29,700 --> 00:55:34,813
What's next, Thelma?
-Well, Louise, I'm not sure if 20 bucks

514
00:55:34,938 --> 00:55:38,070
is gonna get us much
in the way of motor transport.

515
00:55:39,238 --> 00:55:43,046
But I'm not ever
riding an alien horse again.

516
00:55:43,473 --> 00:55:46,148
So I guess it looks
like we're stealing cars.

517
00:55:46,273 --> 00:55:50,081
No, I've watched Rain Man
and in my infinite wisdom

518
00:55:50,116 --> 00:55:53,890
as a celestial being,
working the system is easy.

519
00:55:54,015 --> 00:55:59,108
You hit the slots, then blackjack,
then roulette. Bingo, bango,

520
00:55:59,233 --> 00:56:01,447
luxury ride, Bluetooth sound system,

521
00:56:01,572 --> 00:56:07,316
A.C. and the top down.
Because that's how we roll.

522
00:56:07,441 --> 00:56:09,593
Paris Casino has a strict dress code.

523
00:56:11,449 --> 00:56:15,474
No, you know what? It's a hotel.
These are my vacation clothes.

524
00:56:15,599 --> 00:56:20,758
Get better ones. He's not
wrong. Look at you. -No.

525
00:56:20,883 --> 00:56:25,550
Don't push it, all right, buddy?
-Want a hand? -Yes.

526
00:56:27,772 --> 00:56:31,366
I didn't mean to knock him out. What
are you doing? -He was being a dick.

527
00:56:31,491 --> 00:56:33,652
Yeah, but...
-Look.

528
00:56:37,075 --> 00:56:39,075
We need a disguise.

529
00:56:41,091 --> 00:56:46,348
What are we doing? Hey.
-Hey, man. -Hi.

530
00:56:48,315 --> 00:56:50,708
Oh, God.
-Warm.

531
00:56:56,267 --> 00:57:01,195
Why do you keep knocking people out?
What is wrong with you? Jesus. Why?

532
00:57:02,205 --> 00:57:09,121
So sorry, buddy. I'm so so sorry.
-Eddie! Yeah, baby!

533
00:57:09,246 --> 00:57:14,221
Now, no one will recognize us. Seriously.

534
00:57:14,346 --> 00:57:18,314
You could be voted by People
as the sexiest man of the year.

535
00:57:18,724 --> 00:57:21,208
If anyone cared
who you are anymore.

536
00:57:21,333 --> 00:57:25,660
I've won Sexy Man awards
before. -Of course you have.

537
00:57:27,158 --> 00:57:30,820
The guy who did that, I saw him.
He's between the arch over there.

538
00:57:30,945 --> 00:57:33,045
He shitfaced.
-Thank you, sir.

539
00:57:34,187 --> 00:57:39,787
We are bad people. -Yeah, we are.
-We're keeping his shoes, by the way.

540
00:57:40,959 --> 00:57:45,428
We are so money and we know it.
-Welcome to the Paris.

541
00:57:45,553 --> 00:57:47,511
Thank you.
-No, thank you.

542
00:57:47,512 --> 00:57:49,512
All right? What happened?

543
00:58:03,625 --> 00:58:09,157
Oh, yes! Let me multiply the 20.
Let me quadruply it.

544
00:58:09,282 --> 00:58:13,534
What are you doing?
No, this is all the money that we have.

545
00:58:13,569 --> 00:58:16,809
Luck, be a lady tonight!
-No.

546
00:58:20,024 --> 00:58:22,288
Snazzy jacket!
Let's eat him and steal it.

547
00:58:26,657 --> 00:58:29,658
I know Lady Luck is on our side tonight!

548
00:58:29,659 --> 00:58:32,723
No, I would say that Lady Luck is
definitely not on your side tonight.

549
00:58:32,848 --> 00:58:37,033
But I would even go so far to say
that Lady Luck hates you, buddy.

550
00:58:37,158 --> 00:58:40,991
I can't stop now! -Of course you can't stop.
-What is this feeling?

551
00:58:40,992 --> 00:58:44,495
This feeling? -It's like all of
my problems have gone away!

552
00:58:44,620 --> 00:58:46,620
I do this all the time.

553
00:58:51,383 --> 00:58:53,852
Eddie, I need more money.

554
00:58:56,259 --> 00:59:03,194
But we don't have any more money, buddy.
-Damn! Damn it! -You are sore loser.

555
00:59:03,319 --> 00:59:05,319
You're the sore loser!

556
00:59:07,182 --> 00:59:11,411
I think you broke my foot.
-God, Lady Luck is a fickle slut!

557
00:59:12,140 --> 00:59:18,193
We should have played on that
machine! -Yes, yes! -No fucking way!

558
00:59:20,573 --> 00:59:26,586
Eddie Brock? -Mrs. Chen. Sorry.
-Eddie, it's Mrs. Chen!

559
00:59:26,711 --> 00:59:33,083
Mrs. Chen! -Eddie, baby! -Mrs. Chen!
Mrs. Chen! -I'm gonna cry!

560
00:59:33,208 --> 00:59:38,932
Me too. -Wow. What happened
to you? You look hot!

561
00:59:39,057 --> 00:59:42,265
So do you. -Really hot.
-I always look hot. -Yeah.

562
00:59:42,390 --> 00:59:45,239
Is the big guy in there? -Yeah.
-Do you like my dress?

563
00:59:45,364 --> 00:59:48,305
I've been winning so big, they gave
me a credit line at the clothes store,

564
00:59:48,340 --> 00:59:50,135
and then the penthouse suite.

565
00:59:50,136 --> 00:59:53,999
Wow, you know I stole this suit
of a guy who pissed on me.

566
00:59:54,304 --> 00:59:58,609
I knocked him out, I left him in a bush.
-Well, that explained the stink.

567
00:59:58,770 --> 01:00:01,703
You could use my room to clean up,
and then we party.

568
01:00:01,828 --> 01:00:05,235
That would be so good.
-And room service.

569
01:00:06,537 --> 01:00:08,537
Yes!

570
01:00:18,591 --> 01:00:22,064
We got him.
Positive ID on Brock's CCTV

571
01:00:22,099 --> 01:00:24,099
hit the Paris Hotel, Vegas.

572
01:00:24,799 --> 01:00:29,742
Have we reconstituted the Six?
-Yes, sir. -Put them in.

573
01:00:38,411 --> 01:00:40,468
CONNECTING

574
01:00:42,671 --> 01:00:43,413
CONNECTED

575
01:00:43,414 --> 01:00:47,442
The Six are en route.
They'll bring him in.

576
01:00:48,241 --> 01:00:51,244
But this time I'm requesting control
of the Imperium program.

577
01:00:54,821 --> 01:00:56,821
You have my permission, General.

578
01:01:06,770 --> 01:01:12,052
When thunder roars, head indoors...
head indoors...

579
01:01:12,177 --> 01:01:14,177
head indoors...

580
01:01:29,043 --> 01:01:33,005
Let's dance, baby. -Yeah!
-No. -I love dancing!

581
01:01:33,283 --> 01:01:36,576
Are you crazy? That thing will find us.
-Don't be a party pooper.

582
01:01:36,701 --> 01:01:41,373
No! Do not encourage him.
You know what, Mr. Chen, we are fugitives.

583
01:01:41,498 --> 01:01:44,162
We are on the run,
so thank you for having us.

584
01:01:44,422 --> 01:01:48,489
We gotta go. -You're no fun.
-One last dance before you go.

585
01:01:48,614 --> 01:01:52,634
We never do anything I want to do.
-Just a little dance.

586
01:01:52,759 --> 01:01:56,587
And you gave away my chickens.

587
01:01:58,541 --> 01:02:00,541
Yeah!

588
01:02:06,047 --> 01:02:08,057
Let's cut a rug, Mrs. Chen.

589
01:02:08,484 --> 01:02:10,484
I give up.

590
01:02:19,702 --> 01:02:23,645
Oh no, I cannot unsee that.
I cannot unsee that.

591
01:02:27,183 --> 01:02:31,297
You can dance
You can...

592
01:02:31,745 --> 01:02:35,175
Having the time of your life

593
01:02:42,434 --> 01:02:44,519
When did you two practice this?

594
01:03:08,376 --> 01:03:12,587
God damn it!
-I told you this would happen.

595
01:03:14,340 --> 01:03:18,149
Don't panic, she can't see the
Codex. -What the hell is this?

596
01:03:18,274 --> 01:03:20,274
Wow, so ugly.

597
01:03:21,796 --> 01:03:25,963
Stay very calm. She can't see
the thing she's looking for.

598
01:03:35,499 --> 01:03:37,499
Go! Go!

599
01:03:45,767 --> 01:03:47,767
Leave Eddie alone!
-Shut up!

600
01:03:49,959 --> 01:03:53,475
My shoes.
-Let's go! Move out! Move out!

601
01:04:16,020 --> 01:04:18,447
EXTRATERRESTRIAL HIGHWAY

602
01:04:25,161 --> 01:04:30,498
Area 51.
-Yeah. Yeah.

603
01:04:31,376 --> 01:04:33,376
We made it.

604
01:04:36,113 --> 01:04:38,113
You finally got to see it, Dad.

605
01:04:38,989 --> 01:04:45,555
It's kind of cool. I guess.
-Yeah.

606
01:04:47,647 --> 01:04:51,737
Leaf? Where are you going, hon?

607
01:04:52,105 --> 01:04:56,224
Well, let's see if we can
find us something cooler. Come on.

608
01:04:56,349 --> 01:04:59,237
Come on, guys. -Okay, babe.
Lifelong dream.

609
01:04:59,362 --> 01:05:03,907
All right, go, go...
I smell alien.

610
01:05:09,595 --> 01:05:11,703
He's deteriorating without his host.

611
01:05:12,458 --> 01:05:18,754
Poor thing. -Put him below with
the others. It's safer there.

612
01:05:53,215 --> 01:05:56,709
Down, down. Come on, come on.

613
01:06:04,761 --> 01:06:06,761
All right.

614
01:06:09,265 --> 01:06:11,737
I think we're gonna get
a better view from up there.

615
01:06:13,478 --> 01:06:16,824
Follow me, guys. Come on.
This is so exciting.

616
01:06:17,724 --> 01:06:19,724
I can't believe we're here.

617
01:06:42,335 --> 01:06:44,335
What is this?

618
01:06:55,186 --> 01:06:57,186
It's all broken.

619
01:06:58,213 --> 01:07:00,213
So sad.

620
01:07:12,144 --> 01:07:16,539
Buddy?
Hey, buddy?

621
01:07:18,805 --> 01:07:20,805
No.

622
01:07:26,207 --> 01:07:29,876
How many hangovers
can you have in one day?

623
01:07:31,958 --> 01:07:33,958
Eddie?

624
01:07:38,151 --> 01:07:40,151
Hello?

625
01:07:42,047 --> 01:07:44,047
They did this to me.

626
01:07:46,300 --> 01:07:51,574
Mulligan? -Why?
-You are alive?

627
01:07:52,127 --> 01:07:54,127
What are you doing here?

628
01:07:55,936 --> 01:08:00,458
We're being hunted, Eddie.
You have what he needs.

629
01:08:02,503 --> 01:08:06,376
Protect the Codex from dark hands.

630
01:08:06,979 --> 01:08:12,845
A symbiote army waits here.
Free them.

631
01:08:13,443 --> 01:08:15,443
Protect it, Eddie.

632
01:08:15,649 --> 01:08:20,743
Knull must stay locked away.

633
01:08:26,306 --> 01:08:28,306
Eddie, I'm Dr. Paine.

634
01:08:30,279 --> 01:08:32,516
Where's my friend?
-He's safe for now.

635
01:08:34,170 --> 01:08:37,230
Great news. -Shit.
-We're all done here.

636
01:08:37,231 --> 01:08:39,684
All of this is out of your hands.

637
01:08:40,091 --> 01:08:43,230
This is my lab. -No, no, no, not yours.
You just work here.

638
01:08:43,355 --> 01:08:47,974
Or you did. You, Christmas,
you're going home. -And what about them?

639
01:08:48,099 --> 01:08:51,362
You heard what it said. The Codex
only exists if they're both alive.

640
01:08:51,487 --> 01:08:55,265
Yeah, we're good. We're good.
-You killed one of my people.

641
01:08:55,390 --> 01:08:58,264
I'm returning the favor personally.
Please escort Dr. Payne out here. -No!

642
01:08:58,272 --> 01:09:00,972
Don't move!
-Christmas, time to go.

643
01:09:11,069 --> 01:09:13,069
Big mistake.

644
01:09:19,183 --> 01:09:22,258
Fire!
-Run!

645
01:09:25,420 --> 01:09:27,420
Oh, my God!
-Fall back, fall back!

646
01:09:33,829 --> 01:09:36,129
Venom, run! Go!

647
01:09:43,688 --> 01:09:46,813
Go, move! Clear out!

648
01:09:49,041 --> 01:09:51,041
Release the symbiotes!

649
01:09:53,940 --> 01:09:55,940
Move, move, move!

650
01:10:00,224 --> 01:10:02,224
Come on!
-No!

651
01:10:18,731 --> 01:10:20,731
Jim!

652
01:10:26,224 --> 01:10:28,224
Take her down!

653
01:10:33,895 --> 01:10:37,174
Let's go!
-Take her down!

654
01:11:09,232 --> 01:11:11,232
Come on!

655
01:11:17,281 --> 01:11:19,281
Get the Codex out of here!

656
01:11:26,308 --> 01:11:28,308
That's our way out.

657
01:11:37,860 --> 01:11:40,182
You, break us out of here!

658
01:11:44,071 --> 01:11:46,288
There are no aliens here, kids.

659
01:11:50,930 --> 01:11:52,930
Best shoes ever!

660
01:11:54,256 --> 01:11:56,256
What was that?

661
01:12:00,454 --> 01:12:02,454
Okay.
-We gotta go. Move it!

662
01:12:10,243 --> 01:12:12,534
We are leaving! Move!

663
01:12:13,357 --> 01:12:15,357
Move, move!

664
01:12:17,448 --> 01:12:19,448
Oh, my God. -It's all right.
It's all right, kids. -Oh, my God, baby.

665
01:12:24,563 --> 01:12:29,863
Aliens! Alien invasion!
Alien attack!

666
01:12:37,870 --> 01:12:40,333
Motherfucker!

667
01:12:45,337 --> 01:12:47,429
You two, get airborne!
-Right away, sir!

668
01:12:47,554 --> 01:12:51,853
On me! Move, move move!
In the Hammers, go!

669
01:12:51,978 --> 01:12:54,581
We gotta get the Codex
as far away as possible.

670
01:12:57,068 --> 01:13:01,122
It's Eddie? -It's Eddie.
-It's Eddie. -Eddie! -Eddie!

671
01:13:01,247 --> 01:13:03,247
Oh, no!
-Eddie, Eddie!

672
01:13:05,589 --> 01:13:08,116
Martin and family!

673
01:13:12,822 --> 01:13:15,935
They can't be here, Martin.
-Dark forces, man!

674
01:13:33,464 --> 01:13:38,560
Eddie, can you help us?
-I lied. Aliens are real.

675
01:13:38,685 --> 01:13:40,701
My best friend in the whole world is one.

676
01:13:40,826 --> 01:13:43,181
He's gonna get you out of here, okay?
-Okay.

677
01:13:45,480 --> 01:13:52,148
Don't be scared.
-Hi. -Pleasure to meet you.

678
01:13:53,162 --> 01:13:57,637
Thanks for the chocolate.
-You're welcome.

679
01:14:12,348 --> 01:14:14,348
No!

680
01:14:16,795 --> 01:14:18,795
Mom, dad!

681
01:14:27,671 --> 01:14:29,671
Hold on, kids!

682
01:14:37,349 --> 01:14:39,352
Eddie!

683
01:14:50,282 --> 01:14:55,741
He was trying to protect you.
We are not the bad guys!

684
01:14:58,794 --> 01:15:03,932
Echo! -Leaf. -My baby, my baby. -Mom!
-Thank you, Eddie. -You're welcome.

685
01:15:08,145 --> 01:15:10,145
You gotta be kidding me.

686
01:15:19,742 --> 01:15:23,739
Get in!
-Run, run! Run!

687
01:15:25,348 --> 01:15:27,348
Eddie!

688
01:15:40,349 --> 01:15:43,017
Go, bring me the Codex.

689
01:15:47,003 --> 01:15:50,613
What's that noise?
-She's phoned home.

690
01:15:55,226 --> 01:15:57,226
Shit.

691
01:16:19,324 --> 01:16:23,437
Oh, God! -Get down! Get down! -Come on!
-Get under! Take cover! Take cover!

692
01:16:23,438 --> 01:16:25,438
I got you.

693
01:16:34,587 --> 01:16:36,646
She saved us.

694
01:16:37,635 --> 01:16:40,698
There's only one thing that's
gonna distract them. -Copy.

695
01:16:40,699 --> 01:16:42,699
All right.

696
01:16:44,408 --> 01:16:48,488
Get back to the van!
-Come on! Hurry, hurry!

697
01:16:50,471 --> 01:16:53,059
I'm gonna round them up.
Have the chopper follow me.

698
01:16:55,142 --> 01:16:57,601
Go, go, go! Go!

699
01:17:10,710 --> 01:17:12,710
Go!

700
01:17:13,948 --> 01:17:18,045
He's leading them to a kill box.
When you get a lock, vaporize them!

701
01:17:42,906 --> 01:17:49,182
We're back. Okay, okay. Home.
Go, kids. Go, come on! -Hurry, honey.

702
01:17:49,307 --> 01:17:51,307
Thank you.

703
01:17:52,226 --> 01:17:54,226
Aliens suck!

704
01:18:17,640 --> 01:18:19,714
Light them up!
-Copy that.

705
01:18:31,377 --> 01:18:33,377
Target eliminated.

706
01:18:36,403 --> 01:18:38,132
No!

707
01:18:38,133 --> 01:18:41,540
Thompson down!
Coming down! Go!

708
01:19:04,073 --> 01:19:07,230
Oh, shit! Oh, God!

709
01:19:16,143 --> 01:19:19,812
Let's finish this.
-With pleasure.

710
01:19:25,342 --> 01:19:27,342
The chopper blades.

711
01:19:49,196 --> 01:19:51,196
I got you.

712
01:19:56,496 --> 01:19:58,496
Get him somewhere safe.

713
01:20:00,476 --> 01:20:02,476
Oh, God...

714
01:20:26,470 --> 01:20:31,508
I'm so sorry. I'm sorry.
-Okay, okay.

715
01:20:44,150 --> 01:20:46,150
No!

716
01:20:51,043 --> 01:20:53,471
No!

717
01:20:54,513 --> 01:20:57,398
Okay, okay.

718
01:21:00,039 --> 01:21:02,092
Still living your brother's dream?

719
01:21:09,495 --> 01:21:11,495
Oh, my God.

720
01:21:15,120 --> 01:21:20,031
I'm coming! I'm coming!
-Dad, come on! Dad! Dad!

721
01:21:20,156 --> 01:21:22,156
Go! Come on!

722
01:21:48,062 --> 01:21:51,675
I'm proud of you, Eddie.
You did it all yourself.

723
01:21:53,063 --> 01:21:55,063
Well, some of it.

724
01:22:11,026 --> 01:22:13,614
I really would have
liked to have seen her.

725
01:22:19,101 --> 01:22:25,330
Who? -Lady Liberty.
-Oh, yeah.

726
01:22:26,053 --> 01:22:29,414
Oh, yeah. Yeah, well, we're going.

727
01:22:30,004 --> 01:22:34,667
We're gonna go just as
soon as we get out of here.

728
01:22:36,677 --> 01:22:41,226
They're just going to keep coming.
We'll never leave this place, friend.

729
01:22:41,766 --> 01:22:43,766
Oh, God.

730
01:22:53,235 --> 01:22:55,235
You and I...

731
01:22:57,356 --> 01:22:59,847
I thought we we're gonna
be the Lethal Protector.

732
01:23:03,651 --> 01:23:08,313
We are. That's what this is.

733
01:23:18,335 --> 01:23:20,335
Yeah.

734
01:23:45,274 --> 01:23:47,274
All right.

735
01:23:50,649 --> 01:23:52,649
All right.

736
01:24:03,053 --> 01:24:05,053
Come and get us.

737
01:25:08,755 --> 01:25:11,523
Go. Go.

738
01:25:12,049 --> 01:25:14,049
Go.

739
01:25:19,577 --> 01:25:21,577
Oh, my God.

740
01:25:32,257 --> 01:25:34,257
What are you doing?

741
01:25:36,394 --> 01:25:38,394
I'll never forget you.

742
01:25:41,776 --> 01:25:48,558
Don't forget me either, Eddie.
-No. -Time to go.

743
01:25:50,818 --> 01:25:54,143
Strickland.
-Strickland authorized.

744
01:25:55,480 --> 01:25:57,480
No.

745
01:26:14,464 --> 01:26:17,637
Strickland.
-Strickland authorized.

746
01:26:40,087 --> 01:26:42,281
It's just bye for now.

747
01:27:01,734 --> 01:27:06,142
No... No. No, no!

748
01:27:40,608 --> 01:27:42,608
Go!

749
01:28:09,381 --> 01:28:11,381
No, Eddie!

750
01:28:11,382 --> 01:28:14,991
Eddie.
-Oh my God!

751
01:29:04,509 --> 01:29:06,509
Niereka.

752
01:29:30,799 --> 01:29:32,799
Hey, buddy?

753
01:29:34,095 --> 01:29:36,095
I just had a crazy dream.

754
01:29:43,378 --> 01:29:46,587
Buddy?
-He's not coming back.

755
01:29:54,414 --> 01:29:58,700
But I need him back.
-He wasn't meant for this place.

756
01:29:59,025 --> 01:30:03,663
You couldn't have kept him.
And he couldn't have kept you.

757
01:30:05,460 --> 01:30:09,844
For your bravery, you both have the
heartfelt thanks of a grateful nation.

758
01:30:12,596 --> 01:30:14,702
Eddie, you're free
to start your life again.

759
01:30:15,382 --> 01:30:19,216
Everything that happened in San Francisco
and in the last few days,

760
01:30:19,990 --> 01:30:21,990
consider expunged.

761
01:30:28,211 --> 01:30:30,264
Just so you're clear, of course,

762
01:30:30,747 --> 01:30:33,582
if you breath of word
of this to any living soul,

763
01:30:33,707 --> 01:30:36,130
you will spend the rest of that life

764
01:30:36,255 --> 01:30:39,337
in the coldest, darkest hole imaginable.

765
01:30:41,626 --> 01:30:43,626
Good luck, Eddie.

766
01:32:17,883 --> 01:32:19,883
I won't forget you, buddy.

767
01:32:40,807 --> 01:32:42,807
THERE IS MORE...

768
01:32:45,450 --> 01:32:48,950
<b>VENOM: THE LAST DANCE</b>

769
01:34:52,632 --> 01:34:55,937
Your champion has fallen.

770
01:34:57,184 --> 01:35:00,602
The planets will be mine.

771
01:35:01,317 --> 01:35:07,141
The king in Black is awake.
I will kill your world.

772
01:35:07,477 --> 01:35:10,614
Everyone will burn.

773
01:35:10,739 --> 01:35:15,330
And you will watch.

774
01:35:31,426 --> 01:35:33,426
Hello? Hello?

775
01:35:37,845 --> 01:35:39,979
Hello? Hello?

776
01:36:06,683 --> 01:36:08,683
Subtitles by Bambula
